result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Curtis W. Sandley

records.addlTxt: Status conference on April 13, 2023 at 03:00 pm.
Jury trial - 12 person on May 16, 2023 at 09:00 am.

3:00 PM Cases called: 21CM403 & 22CF573. Defendant Curtis W. Sandley in court.  Attorney Roger M Hillestad in court for Curtis W. Sandley.  Prosecuting attorney Matthew Z Kirkpatrick in court for the State of Wisconsin. This is the time and date set for a Status Conference in these matters. 

There is not an agreement at this time. Defense would like a jury trial set in 22CF573 and have the 21CM403 cases ride along at this time. Parties to contact JA for scheduling.
Status conference on October 12, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

(Cases called at 3:17 PM - 21CM403 and 22CF573)
Defendant Curtis W. Sandley in court with Attorney Roger M Hillestad in court.  Attorney Afton Lewis in court for State of Wisconsin. 
State in compliance with victim notification requirements.  Defense acknowledges the Information, waives reading, and enters Not Guilty pleas to all counts in 22CF573 - received by Court.  Court grants 20 days for motions.  Defense requests status conference in a few weeks. 21CM403 to ride-along for scheduling.
Status Conference:  October 12, 2022 at 3:00 PM (15 minutes; in person)

9:31 AM 21CM403 & 22CF573 Prosecuting attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Curtis W. Sandley in court, in custody.  Attorney Roger M Hillestad in court for Curtis W. Sandley. 

Defendant waives right to a preliminary hearing in 22CF573 and Court accepts waiver. Both cases referred to Br. 2 for scheduling.

9:45 AM Cases called: 21CM403 & 22CF573. Prosecuting attorney Loralee Clark in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Curtis W. Sandley not in court, in custody and not brought over.  Attorney Roger M Hillestad in court for Curtis W. Sandley. Attorney Hillestad just appointed.

Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 07/27/22 at 1:30pm
Hearing scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 09:30 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Amended bond with the correct case numbers (22CF573, 21CM403) - mailed amended bond to Curtis Sandley on 5/31/22.

Conditions:
No contact with M.W. or her residence and T.P. & J.B.
(Covers 22CF573, 21CM40)

(11:15 AM cases 21CM403, 22CF573 called.) Court Commissioner Dan Smetana for Branch 2
Prosecuting attorney Trenton Piltz in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Curtis W. Sandley appeared by video, in custody in the Eau Claire County Jail. Attorney Zebulon Patek appeared by video for Curtis W. Sandley.
Court orders the warrant is quashed.
Defendant waives formal reading of the complaint and time limits for preliminary hearing.
Defendant is advised of charges and potential penalties. 
Defendant is eligible for Public Defender representation.
State requests $1,000.00 cash bond and cites reasoning. Attorney Patek requests signature bond or small cash bond and cites reasoning.
Court orders $500.00 cash bond with conditions to cover both cases.
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on June 20, 2022 at 2:15 pm.
Hearing scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Conditions:
No contact with M.W. or her residence and T.P. & J.B.
(Covers 22CF573, 21CM40)
